message:
Please guys , Excuse my juniority , Do not post MDP , ARS , PRF , ARF , RFD , TFA ,  RDA , RED , TVS , AAD , RTG ,ZZZ ,FFF , RRR ,WWF :)

At least mention the meaning for the short term , thanks.

data.message:
I just want to make it super clear: this is an individual saying please for other members to do something. No one is to feel obligated by this request or think the group has new rules.

While of course it's always a good idea to make sure more people understand what you write so that there is a point in writing it, this is left to common sense and we do not force you to do anything about it.

It may be hard not to understand all of these abbreviations. But you got google :D 
& Even if you are a true geek with huge amount of Knowledge, you will see here some things that  u don'y know. 
So chill out .. We r startin' a New year in few days :D

I think it's a good idea to not go crazy with acronyms especially when they are not that common. If it makes it harder for someone in my target audience to read what I wrote and get what I wanted them to get, then it's my failure not theirs to deliver it.

On the other hand, if you are using really common or industry standard ones that most of your audience should be able to get and / or search, then -unless you need to revisit these assumptions- your usage is OK as it excludes non-targeted audience.
i agree with Mohamed Meligy , if its common or at least unique .. no problems in searching it .. but if it is mysterious and have many clones , it will be hard to find what is meant ..
